title: Permaban Status - 3rd Party Software
body:
Hi Lol Community and Riot Support,

I'm trying to seek some assistance on the subject matter that my account was permabanned 2 days ago (20/01/2020). This was due to utilisation of 3rd party software, scripting in particular, during a game. However, I **HAVE NOT** used any such software or scripts during any of my games, and I am certain my account was compromised (i.e. someone hacked and accessed into my account). Please see the above link for my submitted ticket and relevant info. I'll summarise below the key points. And yes, I don't account share with friends. 

On Sunday around 6-7pm, I tried logging into my account - the client tried to reconnect me to an ARURF game where I was supposedly playing Nautilus. I relogged multiple times and it still did that, so I searched on Google about LoL client reconnecting players to non-existent games. Turns out there were similar cases (such as https://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-en/jtM3EurU-league-trying-to-connect-me-to-a-non-existent-game) so I didn't think much about it. After around 15 minutes, I try to log on again and it works successfully. I assume the game ended and proceeded to play my own ARURF game. Turns out all my ingame settings are changed, and that furthers my suspicion that the LoL server or something accessed my account and resetted all my settings - to me this seemed like a valid reason. 

A day later and Riot tells me my account has been permabanned. I've tried talking to their support team about this, but to no avail they strongly believe I am the culprit. I asked whether an IP address check could be performed since the login would have been from an unusual location - they don't answer my query about that. 

I've read on many other forums or threads that the typical process is that Riot can check the IP address, or go through the Account Recovery option where they ask questions to prove your real ownership of the account. It seems that I'm not getting any of these options at all, and to me, is a bit unfair. There's really nothing else that I can do to prove that someone had indeed accessed my account. I've never been suspended or punished harshly on LoL before; most I've gotten is queue timers and that was quite a while ago.

I've spent a fair bit of money on this game too, so there's not much incentive for me to lose my account forever. I would appreciate any advice or assistance with this matter - doesn't seem like I can get through to Riot about this.

Thanks for your time.

replies.body:
The first step is to change your password and the password of the associated email address (also any other accounts that share either of those passwords).

Then. submit specifically an account recovery ticket to player support: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

As you have guessed, chances are your account was compromised and used for cheats. In most cases, player support can reverse any punitive actions taken as a result of compromise once ownership of the account has been verified, and the account itself has been secured.

There are exceptions to this, but sometimes the compromise is also just a little deeper and not as obvious to support. If you feel something has been missed, you can ask them for a second opinion, but follow through the account recovery first if you haven't already to secure the account.

Hi Ninox, 

Thanks for getting back to me.

I've followed your suggestions and reset password + submitted an account recovery ticket.

In the meantime, do you advise whether I should keep communicating with Jinxed Support (from the original ticket I submitted) about pursuing this investigation, or should I leave it and see how the account recovery ticket goes? Just that it doesn't seem like I can get a second opinion from the original ticket.

Thanks for your help.

I would just follow through with the account recovery ticket. 

It's entirely possible the original agent saw no signs of compromise so didn't redirect you, but the team that handles account recovery (as I understand it) has specialised tools and training to look for deeper instances. Mostly compromise cases are pretty clear cut, but sometimes it's hidden a bit deeper which can cause delays in these sort of circumstances.

Like I said though, there are exceptions/certain situations that would result in you being unable to recover the account. While rare, they do happen, so I can't make any guarantees.

They got back to me but just simply stated that my issue was being dealt with in the original ticket I submitted - I replied back about requesting to go through the account recovery procedure, but is there anything else I can do to help with my case? 

Just sounds like they're reluctant to investigate it at all, and it's getting annoying tbh.

EDIT: link to account recovery ticket https://support-leagueoflegends.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/44977750?page=1

That link is specific to you, no-one else can view your tickets unless you post them publicly.

In that case, wait for a reply to the original ticket. If they don't investigate for compromise in that original ticket, request that they do so and point them to any games played on the account that were not played by you.

Do bear in mind that even if this compromise was entirely out of your hands (you didn't share the account/password/etc)n there are still some circumstances that can result in an account being unrecoverable. It doesn't sound like that is the case here, but I'm just reiterating that I can't give you any definite answers.

Sorry, didn't realise that, I'll attach the text response that they've given back below.

RESPONSE FROM RIOT:
"Hey again,

Thanks for letting me know about this. While I understand that you would like to recover your account, as you were previously told, we checked your account and we couldn't find any sign of compromise on it around the time the suspension was issued. Trust me that we have no intention to not investigate thoroughly and to keep players apart from their account.

Now, as much as I would love to help you get your account back, unfortunately we don't remove suspensions as a whole for anyone. If there was even the smallest possibility for players to appeal their permanent suspensions, trust me that everyone would have this chance.

Well then, if you'll have any other questions or concerns, don't hesitate to contact us anytime and we'll gladly help you out.

Have a great day!

blueivy90,
Player Support"


Looks like I'm out of hope? I honestly don't know how else this can be directed - I'm hoping they did an IP address check already, but if they did, surely something would seem out of place? Are there any last resorts I can look into?

I feel like this is a really unfortunate situation - because I searched online about the LoL client connecting people to non-existent games, I thought the issue was due to a server bug. But apparently not, and now it's got me banned and likely been unconvincing to the support team.

About the only thing you can do from here is request a second opinion. It'll probably bump you back down the queue but you can ask for another agent to review your account.

It is worth noting that if the account was compromised by a friend or family, or other such people with physical access to your account, it's entirely possible they won't be able to verify the compromise. I don't know if that is the case here.

Do I request for that in the original ticket I submitted, or the account recovery ticket (the new one)?

And do I simply just ask "can I get another support team agent to look into it again"? 

I'm almost certain that no-one else has access to my account - but why would that make it difficult to verify? Something to do with IP addresses?

Whichever you were getting replies on (which it sounds like was the first one).

Pretty much, yes, just ask for another agent to take a look.

If for example, a sibling or friend had access to the account and was the one who got it banned, the login patterns may not differ enough from your own, they may have been in the same physical location, it may appear to be intentional account sharing etc etc.

There is a whole slew of metadata that goes into determining a compromise. Sometimes it's more straightforward than others, and you also have to consider that a lot of things many would consider proof of a compromise (like IP changes, summ spell swaps and the like) can all very easily be spoofed, so they need a combination of factors to determine anything with a reasonable degree of certainty. 

This is also largely why their investigation process is kept very obscure, to prevent people from trying to skirt the detection.

Just request a second opinion and we'll go from there.

They've closed the original ticket I submitted, meaning I can't make a response to them anymore. 

Do I have to make the request on the account recovery ticket now? 

I asked about whether they checked the suspicious game specifically and the support agent seems to be unwilling to answer/help furthermore, and stated any further inquiries will go unanswered. See below for his/her reply to my query (this was done on the account recovery ticket).

RESPONSE:
"Hey again,

I truly appreciate your determination to get your account back, yet as I previously mentioned, we couldn't find any signs of compromise when the suspension was issued, and considering this, our decision will remain the same in this case.

Now, considering that we have provided you context and an explanation for the reason of the suspension multiple times, I'm afraid that we'll have to consider this matter closed, and any further inquiries about this will go unanswered.

Have a wonderful day! ^^

blueivy90,
Player Support"

You can try making the request on the account recovery ticket but they may just close it if they deem the issue resolved. The AR ticket is probably best though, by virtue of it not being visible to anyone else who has or has had access to your account.

I've passed on the ticket number for review on my end as well, but our contact does the work of 3 people on a good day so that won't be a fast process at all.

I've just checked the AR ticket now, and it's still open i.e. I can send a reply back to the support team. 

Should I still respond on that ticket and request for a set of fresh eyes on the investigation, or should I wait for the review through the ticket number you passed?

Thanks for that.
Make the request on the AR ticket.
Bump.

Haven't had much time to look at this recently - they've now closed the ticket unfortunately. 

My best chance now to make a new account recovery ticket again and ask for a second review?


Something I remember is that I attempted to log on 4 - 5 times into my account during the time that someone else was playing on my account i.e. the Nautilus ARURF game. Is this something they can track potentially or have recorded?

I've also been permabanned for 3rd party
the things I was doing were arurf and playing runeterra
I've got an unrecognised taliyah match in my history
i'm still waiting on my support ticket to get my account back

Yep, the unrecognised game for me was a Nautilus ARURF game - I've followed through with account recovery but they've yet to get back to me. Been a couple days but hope they're properly investigating these issues.

Account recovery tickets can take a little longer than regular ones just by nature of how complex they are and how much information needs to be verified. If you don't get an answer within a week from when you issued it, I would recommend bumping the ticket (reply to the email).
Surprised they let you keep that name as well....

I hope that isn't part of the reason as to why they don't seem to want to investigate further into this. I did make this account about 7 years ago back in the NA server before shortly transferring to OCE - I'm fine with changing my username if prompted.
